data.title: Gervase as baby Name. Meaning and origin of Gervase
data.meta_description: Gervase is a name of English origin that means "spear servant". It is derived from the Old Germanic name Gervasius, which was composed of the elements "ger" meaning "spear" and "vas" meaning "servant". The name was introduced to England by the Normans in the 11th century and was popularized by Saint Gervase, a 4th-century martyr.
data.text:
Gervase is a name of English origin that means "spear servant". It is derived from the Old Germanic name Gervasius, which was composed of the elements "ger" meaning "spear" and "vas" meaning "servant". The name was introduced to England by the Normans in the 11th century and was popularized by Saint Gervase, a 4th-century martyr. The name has been in use in England since the Middle Ages and has been borne by several notable individuals throughout history.

The name Gervase is predominantly male, although it has been used for both genders in the past. It is pronounced as JER-vays or JER-viss, with the emphasis on the first syllable. The name has several variations, including Gervas, Gervais, and Jervis. In terms of popularity, Gervase is not a common name and is considered quite rare in modern times.

The name Gervase is composed of two elements, "ger" and "vas", which have significant meanings. "Ger" means "spear", which was a common weapon in medieval times and symbolizes strength and courage. "Vas" means "servant", which represents humility and loyalty. Together, these elements create a name that embodies the qualities of a brave and loyal servant. Overall, Gervase is a unique and meaningful name with a rich history and significant symbolism.
